articles.title: Kim Jong Un Enjoys Performance Given by Orchestra of 21st Century of Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Enjoys Performance Given by Orchestra of 21st Century of Russia
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un together with Ri Sol Ju enjoyed the performance given by the visiting Orchestra of 21st Century of Russia at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Oct. 15.
					 They were greeted by Pavel Ovsyannikov, head and chief conductor of the orchestra, and Natalia Ivanovna Semyonova, administrative manager of the orchestra.
					
					 Kim Jong Un warmly welcomed the DPRK visit of the orchestra and had a cordial talk with the guests.
					
					 Recalling that General Secretary Kim Jong Il watched the performance of the orchestra several times, Kim Jong Un appreciated the performing activities conducted by the orchestra, contributing to the development of the bilateral friendly relations.
					
					 The head of the orchestra expressed sincere thanks to Kim Jong Un on behalf of his orchestra for sparing his precious time to watch its performance and renewed his resolution to contribute to boosting the bilateral friendly relations between the two countries.
					
					 The orchestra which came to the DPRK on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Russia put on the stage a chorus and orchestra, a collection of famous songs on the theme of opera "Rusulan and Ludmila" composed by Glinka, and female solo "Flying in the Sky over Russia" and other colorful numbers.
					
					 The artistes made a truthful artistic representation of the warm love of the Russian people for the country and their traditional custom and national emotion.
					
					 A chorus and orchestra "Forward towards Stars" composed by the head of the orchestra deeply impressed the audience.
					
					 The artistes well known to the Korean people sang songs "Ardent Desire" and "Song of Comradeship" successfully represented to suit the thinking and feelings of the Korean people.
					
					 Kim Jong Un congratulated the artistes on their successful performance.
					
					 At the end of the performance, he met with the leading members of the orchestra and expressed thanks to them for presenting a splendid performance   to the delight of the Korean people.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, creators and artistes of the art organizations of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and art education institutions, teachers, students and other citizens in Pyongyang.
					
					 Russian embassy officials also appreciated the performance.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Enjoys Joint Performance Given by Moranbong Band and State Merited Chorus
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Enjoys Joint Performance Given by Moranbong Band and State Merited Chorus
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un appreciated a joint performance "Long Live the Workers' Party of Korea" given by the Moranbong Band and the State Merited Chorus together with members of the Orchestra of the 21st Century of Russia and citizens in Pyongyang on Tuesday.
					 Among the audience were Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Pavel Ovsyannikov, head and chief conductor of the orchestra, and Natalia Ivanovna Semyonova, administrative manager of the orchestra.
					
					 The performance began with overture "We Sing of the Party".
					
					 Put on the stage were female chorus "Ode to the Motherland", light music and serial songs "Mother Party Which Protected My Destiny", male chorus "Our Future Is Bright", female group singing and chorus "Let's Defend Socialism", mixed chorus "His Great Name Is the Banner of Victory" and epilogue "Long Live the Workers' Party of Korea".
					
					 The audience was mesmerized by the performance.
					
					 Kim Jong Un congratulated the artistes on their successful performance.
					
					 At the end of the performance Kim Jong Un met with Pavel Ovsyannikov and Natalia Ivanovna Semyonova again.
					
					 Pavel Ovsyannikov expressed sincere thanks to Kim Jong Un, saying that he invited the orchestra to watch the joint performance given by the Moranbong Band and the State Merited Chorus after appreciating the performance of his orchestra.
					
					 He said in an excited tone that the joint performance was the performance of the highest level and a really splendid one full of dynamism, vigor and stamina.
					
					 Kim Jong Un expressed belief and expectation that artistes of the two countries would conduct joint performances and a lot of exchanges to contribute to enriching the mankind's treasure house of culture and arts.

articles.title: Greetings to Mongolian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Mongolian President
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj, president of Mongolia, on Tuesday, the 65th anniversary of the establishment of the DPRK-Mongolia diplomatic ties.
					 Kim Yong Nam said in the message that the people of the two countries have constantly developed the genuine ties of friendship and cooperation in the common idea for independent development since the establishment of the bilateral ties on Oct. 15, 1948.
					
					 He said he was pleased to see the long-standing and traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries developing on good terms in diverse fields in recent years, and expressed the belief that these relations will grow stronger by the common efforts in the future, too.
					
					 He sincerely wished the friendly Mongolian people further progress and prosperity and the president of Mongolia fresh success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Greetings to Mongolian Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade
articles.content:
Greetings to Mongolian Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Tuesday sent a message of greeting to the minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Mongolia on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Mongolia.
					 The message said that since the establishment of the diplomatic ties the peoples of the two countries have steadily carried forward the tradition of friendship and cooperation.
					
					 The message expressed belief that the good relations between the two countries would steadily develop in more fresh and diverse fields in line with the aspiration and desire of the two peoples in the future, too.
					
					 Reiterating the firm stand and will to boost the ties and cooperation between the two ministries for further developing the traditional relations of the two countries, the message wished the minister greater success in his work.

articles.title: Munsu Water Park Completed
articles.content:
Munsu Water Park Completed 
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The Munsu Water Park, monumental edifice for the people, was splendidly built in Pyongyang. 
					 The large water park sprang up on the picturesque bank of the Taedong River thanks to the noble outlook of Marshal Kim Jong Un on the people and future. It is the people's leisure complex where working people and school youth and children can enjoy a highly civilized and happy emotional life. 
					
					 Covering 109,000 square meters, the park has an open-air wading pool with various water slides and water tanks, comprehensive indoor wading pool, the Munsu Recovery Center and gymnasium. It has all amenities so that visitors can have good rest there all the year round. 
					
					 An inaugural ceremony took place on Tuesday. 
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Pak Pong Ju, Jang Jong Nam and other senior party, state and army officials, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, soldier-builders, people from all walks of life, school youth and children, the chief of the Pyongyang Mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front and overseas Koreans. 
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of various countries, representatives of international bodies and military attaches with their wives, staff members of foreign embassies here and foreign guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					 Pak Pong Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and premier of the DPRK Cabinet, made an address. 
					
					 He said that the water park is the edifice built thanks to KPA service personnel's spirit of devotedly carrying out any project and their fighting traits as they are ready to flatten even a high mountain at a go in hearty response to the order of the supreme commander.
					
					 He stressed the need for officials and employees of the water park to serve the people in the spirit of devoted service to them and take good care of all facilities so as to glorify forever Kim Jong Un's leadership exploits and make sure that the party's warm love for the people reaches the working people and school youth and children. 
					
					 Standing before the tape for opening the water park were Kim Ki Nam, Ro Tu Chol and leading officials of the units which took part in the construction.
					
					 It was cut by representatives of school youth and children and working people who would use the water park, representatives of the soldier-builders who took part in the construction and Mun Kyong Dok, secretary of the C.C., the WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK. 
					
					 The people from all walks of life and school youth and children participating in the ceremony were deeply admired to go round different places of the Munsu Water Park successfully built as a leisure complex for the people to be proud of before the world.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Acquaints Himself with Farm Work
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Acquaints Himself with Farm Work
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the Yoldusamchon Farm in Sukchon County and the Ansok Co-op Farm in Onchon County of South Phyongan Province. Those farms are making successes in harvesting and threshing.
					 The premier had a talk with the functionaries of the primary organizations and farmers who distinguished themselves in harvesting and threshing. At the talk he congratulated them on their successes and made inquiries about the crop estimate and supply of materials by the relevant units.
					
					 He summoned a consultative meeting where he called for concentrating all efforts and mobilizing all means for farming and doing farming in scientific and technological way to carry out behests of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, true to the intentions of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He underscored the need to direct efforts to cultivating high-yielding crops of new species suited to the geographical and climatic conditions of the country under the Workers' Party of Korea's policy for bringing about a radical turn in seed selection.
					
					 He called for pushing ahead with the work to make revolution in agricultural science and technology and industrialize and modernize the farming. He also made sure that measures were taken for the supply by the relevant units of electricity and fuel necessary for harvesting and threshing to successfully conclude this year's farming.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Syrian Charge d'Affaires Ad Interim
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Syrian Charge d'Affaires Ad Interim
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, had a talk with Tammam Sulaiman, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy here, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets WHO Delegation
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets WHO Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun had a talk with a delegation of the World Health Organization (WHO) led by Samlee Plianbangchang, director of the Regional Office for South-East Asia, who paid a courtesy call on him on Tuesday.
					 Present there were officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the WHO representative here.

articles.title: Reception Given on Anniversary of Establishment of DPRK-Mongolia Diplomatic Ties
articles.content:
Reception Given on Anniversary of Establishment of DPRK-Mongolia Diplomatic Ties
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Foreign Ministry on Tuesday hosted a reception on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the establishment of the DPRK-Mongolia diplomatic ties.
					 Invited to the reception were Manibadrakh Ganbold, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, and officials of his embassy.
					
					 Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Vice-Foreign Minister Pak Kil Yon and officials concerned were present there.
					
					 Pak Ui Chun said the relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Mongolia have greeted a new heyday of their development thanks to the particular care of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 He noted it is the fixed stand of the DPRK government to boost the long-standing friendship with Mongolia as required by the new era.
					
					 He wished Mongolian government and people greater successes in their work to achieve the socio-political stability and unity and develop the economy and national culture. 
					
					 The Mongolian ambassador said in a speech that the Mongolian people together with the DPRK people are significantly marking the 65th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries.
					
					 The Mongolian ambassador stressed the need to further expand and develop the cooperative relations between the two countries in different fields.
					
					He expressed the belief that a new chapter of the bilateral ties of friendship and cooperation would be opened this significant year.

articles.title: DPRK Government Hosts Banquet for Congolese Delegation
articles.content:
DPRK Government Hosts Banquet for Congolese Delegation 
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government hosted a banquet in honor of the visiting Congolese government delegation on Tuesday.
					 Present there on invitation were members of the delegation headed by Gakosso Jean Claude, minister of Culture and Art. 
					
					 DPRK Minister of Culture Pak Chun Nam and officials concerned were present there.

articles.title: DPRK Designers' Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
DPRK Designers' Delegation Leaves for China
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation of designers led by Kim Sok Jun, director of the State Designing Guidance Bureau, left here on Tuesday to visit China.

articles.title: French Delegation Visits Different Places
articles.content:
French Delegation Visits Different Places 
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The visiting delegation of the French Group for the Study of the DPRK of senate members from different parties led by Chairman Jean-Claude Frecon, senate member from the French Socialist Party, visited the Rungna Dolphinarium. 
					 After being briefed on the dolphinarium splendidly built on the picturesque Rungna Islet, the delegation spent a pleasant time watching skills of dolphins. 
					
					 The delegation also visited the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Rungna 4-D Simulation Cinema, etc.

articles.title: Russian Orchestra Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Russian Orchestra Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Members of the Orchestra of the 21st Century of Russia led Pavel Ovsyannikov, head and chief conductor of the orchestra, visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Tuesday. 
					 They paid high tribute to the statues of the peerlessly great men who made immortal contributions to the development of the DPRK-Russia friendly relations. 
					
					 They entered the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state and paid homage to them in the humblest reverence.
					
					 They went round with keen interest the rooms where the orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are on display and the halls that house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches they used during their field guidance and foreign trip till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 Pavel Ovsyannikov made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: DPRK Team Wins Men's Soccer Matches of 6th East Asian Games
articles.content:
DPRK Team Wins Men's Soccer Matches of 6th East Asian Games
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team won the men's soccer matches of the 6th East Asian Games.
					 It enjoyed 3:0 lead in around 45, 51 and 63 minutes in Monday's match with the Chinese team.
					
					 It placed first in the men's soccer matches with the total of 10 points.

articles.title: DPRK Team Beats Its Myanmar Rival 2:0
articles.content:
DPRK Team Beats Its Myanmar Rival 2:0
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK football team Tuesday trounced its Myanmar rival 2:0 in the 2013 Asian U-19 Women's Football Championship now under way in Nanjing, China.
					 The DPRK team will have fourth match with the south Korean team on Friday.

articles.title: Families of More Teachers, Researchers of Kim Il Sung University Move to New Flats
articles.content:
Families of More Teachers, Researchers of Kim Il Sung University Move to New Flats
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Twin high-rise apartment houses for teachers and researchers of Kim Il Sung University are alive everyday with their families moving into new flats.
					 Trucks carrying household goods arrived at the apartment houses having all amenities on Tuesday, too. They have been put on the basis of formative art of architecture as required by the new century. 
					
					 Dr. and Assistant Prof. Kim Pyong Yon, lecturer at the university, said in an excited tone:
					
					 It was the great father, the grateful party and country, that made me, son of an ordinary worker, study at the university to be a teacher of the highest seat of Juche-based education. 
					
					 I have not lived up to this loving care and trust yet but have been provided with this wonderful new flat. This is the greatest privilege for the educators of Songun Korea holding Marshal Kim Jong Un in high esteem.
					
					 Dr. and Prof. Nam Il Ryong who is a researcher at the university had this to say: The flat is so marvelous that I feel as if I entered a palace.
					
					  I imagined that the new house would be fashionable but my flat baffled my imagination.
					
					 I can hardly believe this is my flat.
					
					Words fail to express gratitude to Kim Jong Un for providing this deluxe flat to me as a gift.
					
					 I keenly feel once again how great the party's idea and policy of attaching importance to science and valuing talents are.
					
					 Merited Scientist Ri Chol Su, a chief of a section, and Kim Yong Nam, a researcher, and everyone else, said with excitement that they are the happiest people in the world.
					
					 They renewed their pledges to repay Kim Jong Un's warm solicitude by registering successes in the training of talents and scientific researches, enshrining the pride and honor of being career revolutionaries who live and work under his loving care and blessings.

articles.title: South Hwanghae Province Hits Its Yearly Cocoon Production Target
articles.content:
South Hwanghae Province Hits Its Yearly Cocoon Production Target
 Haeju, October 15 (KCNA) -- Various cocoon production stations in South Hwanghae Province fulfilled their yearly cocoon production plans.
					 The cocoon production stations in Unchon, Samchon and Jaeryong honored their yearly plans at 150, 121 and 104 percent.
					
					 They applied quality organic compost to mulberry fields and channeled efforts into manuring and cultivation.
					
					 They, at the same time, put the breeding of young silkworms and silkworm raising on a scientific and technological basis according to different phases.
					
					 They made sure that silkworms were raised without distinction and cocoons gathered in good time by properly adjusting temperature and humidity and ensuring fresh air despite unfavorable weather conditions during summer and rainy season.
					
					 They are now making good preparations for cocoon production next year.

articles.title: Traditional Korean Costume Exhibition
articles.content:
Traditional Korean Costume Exhibition
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- A traditional Korean costume exhibition is going on in the Pyongyang Folklore Park.
					 On display there are some 100 models of costumes dating back to Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668), Koryo Kingdom (918-1392) and the Feudal Joson Dynasty (1392-1910).
					
					 The exhibits show the development and superiority of the national costumes.
					
					 Ri Sun Hui, a researcher of the Korean Folklore Museum, told KCNA:
					
					 Touring the Pyongyang Folklore Park last year, supreme leader Kim Jong Un called on historians to unearth and ascertain the traditional costumes in an overall way.
					
					 The ongoing exhibition displays various kinds of national costumes unearthed in different parts of the country and ascertained in a scientific way through academic deliberation.
					
					 Among the exhibits are commoner clothes discovered in the murals of Kamsin Tomb, female dresses in Anak Tomb No.1 and Susan-ri Tomb and female patrician overwear and artistes' dresses in Three Tombs in Kangso District, which are typical of the costumes in the period of Koguryo.
					
					 There are also various sorts of female clothes, divided into work clothes, casuals and seasonal clothes, dating back to Koryo Kingdom and the Feudal Joson Dynasty.
					
					 Besides, they include models of female overcoat in the period of Koryo Kingdom, chima and jogori (skirt and jacket for woman) in the period from the 15th century to the 16th century and skirts and jackets in the 17th-18th centuries and those in the period from the 19th century to early the 20th century, whose shapes and colors show the emotion and aesthetic tastes of the Koreans.
					
					 We will strive to unearth more traditional costumes, associated with the wisdom and talents of the nation, thus contributing to the development of the national inheritance.

articles.title: Fitness Center in Pyongyang Daily Crowded with Citizens
articles.content:
Fitness Center in Pyongyang Daily Crowded with Citizens
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The Fitness Center in Thongil Street, Pyongyang, is visited by at least 1 000 schoolchildren and working citizens every day.
					 The center has various kinds of latest exercise and treatment apparatuses, and especially exercise apparatus for running is very popular among its visitors.
					
					 Kim Yong Sil, a worker of the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill, told KCNA that she loves this apparatus as it can control momentum according to physical constitution.
					
					 A woman using the cycling apparatus said with joy that it is helpful to making a good figure and treating lumbar and leg pains.
					
					Cha Kwang Ok, a researcher of the health recovery room at the center, said that many women frequent the center to get facial treatment and massage.
					
					 Kang Jong Suk, chief of the service section at the center, said that more than 200,000 citizens visited the center in one year after the start of its operation on October 16, 2012. All of them were unanimous in saying the center gives freshness and strength, she added.
					
					 Such mass sports and cultural facilities as the fitness center have been taking their shapes one after another in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to provide the people with better living conditions.

articles.title: DPRK Citizens Hit at Park Geun Hye's Confrontation Moves
articles.content:
DPRK Citizens Hit at Park Geun Hye's Confrontation Moves
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The citizens of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea are now enraged at the south Korean regime's persistent confrontation policy.
					 Some days ago, a spokesman for the Policy Department of the DPRK National Defence Commission advised that Park Geun Hye of south Korea, if she truly ranks among politicians, should open her mouth to suit her capacity, clearly judging how the things go about in the world, and that her group should seriously reflect on what they did before blaming others.
					
					 But the Park group responded this advice with the start of DPRK-targeted large-scale joint naval maneuvers involving the U.S. aggression forces.
					
					 Moreover, Park malignantly slandered the DPRK during her trip to Southeast Asia. Whenever she met with foreign dignitaries, she behaved so disgustingly as asking them to "persuade north Korea to dismantle its nukes and focus efforts on economic development".
					
					 In this regard, Kim Myong Gon, an official of the State Academy of Sciences, told KCNA:
					
					 "It is very ridiculous for them to slander the dignity and social system of the DPRK.
					
					 Before talking about others' livelihood, Park Geun Hye should put on the right track the south Korean society where human rights and independent life are violated without mercy.
					
					 It is the fixed will of the DPRK to go along the line of simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force."
					
					 Pak Yong Nam, an official of the South Phyongan Provincial People's Committee, said that Park Geun Hye's behavior is tantamount to digging her own grave.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts "Tailored Deterrence Strategy"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts "Tailored Deterrence Strategy"
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces have gone reckless the way they have nothing to be afraid of in the world after confirming the "tailored deterrence strategy" with the U.S.
					 They are bragging they would "raise the people's confidence in the effective deterrence to the north based on south Korea-U.S. alliance and the U.S. commitment to providing the extended deterrence", saying that they "feel relieved".
					
					 They are now in a high spirit counting on the outsiders just like a new born puppy unafraid of a tiger. It is the height of irony.
					
					 The senseless and cursed traitors are making nuclear blackmails against their fellow countrymen, counting on the U.S., a country in the American Continent far away from them.
					
					 Not only south Korea but the U.S. will suffer if a nuclear war breaks out on the Korean Peninsula. How can the U.S. defend its stooges when it can not save itself?
					
					The maniacs clamoring for a preemptive nuclear attack on the fellow countrymen seem to live in a dreamland, un-thoughtful of the consequences.
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that a lawmaker from the "Saenuri Party" which sides with the conservative group said "all things are useless. If even a single nuke is dropped, the world will come to its end. It is absolutely unrealistic to think that we can mount a preemptive attack on the north possessed of nuclear weapons."
					
					 The DPRK has all means and forces for coping with the U.S. and the south Korean forces' adventurous moves for a nuclear war against the DPRK.
					
					 Nothing can frighten the DPRK, whether it is "tailored deterrence strategy" or a nuclear carrier.
					
					 The puppet forces are siding with the outsiders and going reckless to force the DPRK to disarm itself. It is an act little short of digging one's own grave.
					
					 The preemptive nuclear attack under the "tailored deterrence strategy" will only result in bringing a bolt from the blue over their heads.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Steadily Holding Fast to Songun Revolutionary Idea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Steadily Holding Fast to Songun Revolutionary Idea 
Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution", the work supreme leader Kim Jong Un made public on the occasion of the Day of Songun, serves as a powerful ideological and moral weapon for powerfully encouraging the army and people of the DPRK in their advance along the road of Songun revolution.
					Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in an editorial. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The work published on August 25, Juche 102 (2013) comprehensively systemizes the scientific accuracy, validity and invincible vitality of the revolutionary idea of General Secretary Kim Jong Il including the essence and starting point of Songun idea and the revolutionary and political theories clarified by it.
					
					 Songun represents the historic roots and tradition of the Korean revolution and a permanent path leading to victory.
					
					 It is the bounden duty and revolutionary moral obligation of the army and people of the DPRK, the soldiers and disciples loyal to Kim Jong Il, to steadily hold fast to the idea of the Songun revolution.
					
					 The revolutionary idea of Songun is the most scientific strategy and tactics for accomplishing the cause of socialism in our era and a powerful treasured sword in the anti-imperialist struggle.
					
					 Unshakable is the will of the army and people of the DPRK to uphold and glorify the socialist cause of Juche to the last by holding fast to the Songun idea of Kim Jong Il as an ever-victorious banner.
					
					 The Korean people have strong pluck and the future of the great Paektusan nation is rosy thanks to the great revolutionary guiding idea and guidelines such as the Songun idea.
					
					 All party members, service personnel of the People's Army and people should dynamically advance along the road of Songun revolution, holding fast to Kim Jong Il's idea of the Songun revolution, and thus powerfully demonstrate the invincible might of the DPRK and its spirit of achieving prosperity.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's idea of the Songun revolution is an ever-victorious banner of the Korean revolution.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday dedicates an article to the 10th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On Thoroughly Implementing the Party's Line of Attaching Importance to Science and Technology".
					 The work, published on October 15, Juche 92 (2003), is an important work which reflects the iron-will of Kim Jong Il to further glorify the DPRK as an invincible socialist state, holding fast to the party's line of attaching importance to science and technology.
					
					 The past decade since the publication of the work represents a shining history in which a new turn took place in the development of science and technology of the country under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea, the article said, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il regarded the policy of attaching importance to science and technology along with policies of giving importance to ideology and arms as the three mainstays for building a thriving socialist nation and wisely led the struggle to develop science and technology.
					
					 It is the unshakable will of supreme leader Kim Jong Un to bring about a turning phase of building a thriving nation by dint of science and technology, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Un's wise leadership serves as an engine to raise the patriotic enthusiasm and intellectual potential of the scientists and technicians to the maximum and bring about miracles and innovations in the building of a knowledge-based economic power.
					
					 The present era is the age of science and technology and knowledge-based economy. 
					
					 Science and technology play the role of an engine steering the era and serve as a powerful driving force to dynamically build a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The prosperity of the country and the nation is guaranteed when the country rapidly develops its science and technology by thoroughly implementing the party's line of attaching importance to science and technology.
					
					 It is the party's intention and requirement to leap forward to the world-standard by skipping the phases covered by others in the development of science and technology.
					
					 The DPRK's scientists and technicians are achieving such signal successes as increasing the scientific and technological potentials of Songun Korea through a drive for the development of overall science and technology, while channeling primary efforts into the development of core essential technologies under the wise leadership of the party.
					
					 The article calls upon all the officials, scientists, technicians and working people to thoroughly implement the party's line of attaching importance to science and technology, deeply aware that the development of science and technology assures the prosperity of the country and the nation.

articles.title: Imperialists' Moves to Force "Democracy" of Their Style on Other Countries Denounced
articles.content:
Imperialists' Moves to Force "Democracy" of Their Style on Other Countries Denounced 
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The imperialists' moves to force "democracy" of their style on other countries are robber-like acts to seek their own interests at the sacrifice of others and realize their ambition for domination from A to Z, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article. 
					 The article goes on:
					
					 By origin, democracy in each country should be established in line with the aspiration and requirements of its own people, not by coercion of outside forces. 
					
					  For foreign forces to pressurize other countries to introduce their "democracy," showcasing it as an example, is an insult and mockery of the people of those countries. 
					
					 It is the sophism of the paid trumpeters of the imperialists to claim that Western style "democracy" is one of the highest level in the development of history. 
					
					 Western style "democracy" is, in essence, American style "democracy". It is based on pragmatism seeking individual self-interests as it regards it as "truth" to gain profits irrespective of methods. It is the most reactionary one and unpopular bourgeois political mode as it does not reflect the will and requirements of the toiling people, but interests of monopoly capitalists and absolutely protects their interests. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the imperialist forces including the U.S. openly use force to impose their rotten "democracy" upon other countries. Their moves seriously affect the international community. 
					
					 The situation goes to prove that every country should keep strong in order to choose democracy suited to its actual situation and protect it. Imperialists cannot try to impose their political mode on strong countries.
					
					 Any country desirous of independence should stand up with stronger force against the imperialists' moves to impose Western style "democracy" upon it.

articles.title: Minju Joson Urges Park Geun Hye Group to Stop Racket over Minutes of Inter-Korean Summit
articles.content:
Minju Joson Urges Park Geun Hye Group to Stop Racket over Minutes of Inter-Korean Summit 
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime is busy kicking up a smear campaign after the prosecution recently announced the results of interim investigation into the case that the Roh Moo Hyun regime kept the minutes of the north-south summit in 2007 in the private data base, instead of transferring them to the Archives of Minutes, and deleted their draft.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday in a commentary observes in this regard:
					
					 The south Korean puppet group kicked up the anti-DPRK smear campaign, crying out for opening to public the voice data after raising the issue of the minutes of the summit again. This is a disgraceful behavior of political hooligans bereft of elementary diplomatic sense and the courtesy and principle of dialogue, an undisguised politically-motivated provocation against the DPRK.
					
					 Park Geun Hye is the backstage manipulator of such campaign aimed to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 The DPRK side strongly warned that it may open to public all what the south Korean rulers and special envoys uttered in the DPRK to please it, now that Park Geun Hye and her group are besmirching the minutes of the inter-Korean summit and opening them to public. It is clear that what Park said during her visit to Pyongyang is also on the list of what should be opened to public. In case her remarks are opened to public, everybody can guess in what mayhem south Korea will find itself and into what embarrassing position Park will be thrown.
					
					 As recognized by the international community, the DPRK does what it determined to do. The future development of the situation will depend on how Park and her group will react to the warning of the DPRK.
					
					 The puppet group had better behave itself, pondering over the grave consequences to be entailed by its racket over the minutes.

articles.title: U.S. Missile Test Designed for World Hegemony Censured
articles.content:
U.S. Missile Test Designed for World Hegemony Censured
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Recently the U.S. Air Force test-fired Minuteman-3, inter-continental ballistic missile, at an air force base in California. Three days before the launch, it test-fired a missile of the same type.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The U.S. launched inter-continental ballistic missiles one after another, reeking off the smell of powder, at a time when the world is standing for peace, reconciliation and cooperation. This is a military racket going against the trend of the times.
					
					 Whenever it felt the need to bring down other countries through the threat by use of force, the U.S. rendered the situation tense, wielding latest weapons.
					
					 Regarding the DPRK, holding high the banner of independence, Songun and socialism, as a thorn in the flesh, the U.S. has posed grave nuclear threats to it in a bid to stifle it by force of arms.
					
					 The hard-won atmosphere of peace and dialogue has been tarnished and the situation on the Korean Peninsula is being pushed into an extreme phase again due to the U.S. moves for stifling the DPRK by force of arms and escalating confrontation with it.
					
					 The U.S., however, test-fired the inter-continental ballistic missiles, putting more pressure on the DPRK with nuclear strike means. This fully reveals that the U.S. is the arch criminal wrecking peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 The world is forced to get embroiled in the whirlwind of arms race now that the U.S. is openly seeking the policy for confrontation by strength while dreaming world supremacy by military upper-hand.
					
					 The U.S. had better face up to the trend of the times and discard the old conception of confrontation.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Unpopular Rule Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Unpopular Rule Assailed
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- At least 3 000 self-supporting  businessmen of south Korea held a rally around the building of the "National Assembly" on Oct. 11 in protest against the puppet government's unpopular tax policy, according to south Korean KBS.
					 At the rally speakers accused the authorities of trying to adopt a bill to levy excessive taxes on the poor self-supporting businessmen.
					
					 This is a behavior threatening the life of the poor people, they said, urging the authorities to immediately cancel the bill.

articles.title: Koreans in Russia Mark Anniversary of WPK
articles.content:
Koreans in Russia Mark Anniversary of WPK 
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the Maritime Territory of the Russian Federation held round-table talks at the DPRK consulate general in Nakhodka on October 10, the 68th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Present there were the vice-chairman of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia, the chairman of the Korean National Cultural Autonomous Society in Nakhodka, the chairman of the Korean National Cultural Autonomous Society in Partizansk City and other compatriots and consuls of the consulate general.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket and bouquets before the full-length painting of President Kim Il Sung standing together with General Secretary Kim Jong Il on top of Mt. Paektu and paid tribute to them.
					
					 At the round-table talks speakers praised Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for founding the WPK and strengthening it into an ever-victorious and iron-willed party.
					
					 The DPRK has made spectacular achievements in building an economic power and a highly civilized socialist nation under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, they noted.
					
					 They expressed conviction that the WPK would as ever demonstrate only victory and glory as it is under his leadership.
					
					 They expressed their will to conduct a positive patriotic movement for reunification, bearing deep in mind the national pride.

articles.title: Koreans in Uzbekistan Release Special Issue of Their Paper
articles.content:
Koreans in Uzbekistan Release Special Issue of Their Paper
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Thongil, a newspaper of Koreans in Uzbekistan, carried a special write-up on October 10 on the occasions of the 68th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the 6th anniversary of the October 4 declaration.
					 Under the title "DPRK greets 68th anniversary of WPK on Oct. 10" the paper gave an account of an event held by the "Old Men" Association for Korean Cultural Tradition in Uzbekistan.
					
					 It also carried the full text of the "Declaration for Development of North-South Relations and Peace and Prosperity."

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Talk Carried in Bulletin of Mexican Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Talk Carried in Bulletin of Mexican Organization
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The detailed gist of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's talk "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution" was carried by the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea in its bulletin on October 8. The talk was published in Rodong Sinmun, organ of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Joson Inmingun, organ of the Korean People's Army, on August 25 (Day of Songun), Juche 102 (2013).
					 The talk deals with the Songun revolutionary feats of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and clarifies the essence and originality of the idea of the Songun revolution and the tasks to be carried out to successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Songun.

articles.title: British Organization Posts Kim Jong Il's Work on Its Website
articles.content:
British Organization Posts Kim Jong Il's Work on Its Website
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its website General Secretary Kim Jong Il's famous work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" on October 3.
					 The work, made public on October 2, Juche 84 (1995), serves as a great programme for party building and activities as it reviews with pride the glorious history of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) in which it explored a new way of building a revolutionary party in the era of independence under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and indicates the way of developing the WPK into an eternal party of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: WPK's Anniversary Marked in Italy
articles.content:
WPK's Anniversary Marked in Italy
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- A seminar on exploits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, a briefing on their works, a lecture and a book and photo exhibition took place in Rome on October 9 on the occasion of the 68th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were photos documenting the exploits Marshal Kim Jong Un performed by leading the Songun revolution.
					
					 On display there were works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and books and photos introducing the Korean people's struggle for building an economic power.
					
					 The general secretary of the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy said that the President laid down an original line for party building in the early period of his revolutionary activities, made full preparations for it during the anti-Japanese armed struggle and founded the WPK without delay after Korea's liberation on the basis of them.
					
					 The Korean people beat back the U.S. imperialists' aggression under the leadership of the party headed by Kim Il Sung and won a brilliant victory in postwar rehabilitation and construction and socialist construction, the general secretary noted.
					
					 The department director of a district committee of Rome Municipality of the Communist Party of Italy said at a briefing on Kim Jong Il's famous work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" that the history of the WPK shining with victory and glory was one in which it has developed into the most revolutionary and militant party under the leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il 
					
					 Speakers including the director of the Youth Department of the Leftwing People's Party of Communists of Italy who is national coordinator of the Communist Youth Front of Italy gave their impressions of the DPRK. They noted that they were greatly admired by the reality of the DPRK where the people are bringing about a fresh leap forward and innovations in the building of an economic power under the leadership of the great party.

articles.title: DPRK Book, Photo and Art Exhibitions Held Abroad
articles.content:
Book, Photo and Art Exhibitions Held Abroad
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Korean book, photo and art exhibitions were held in Russia, Bulgaria and Peru between October 2 and 8 on the occasion of the 68th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Displayed in the venues of the exhibitions were photos documenting immortal exploits President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un performed in leading the party building and the Songun revolution.
					
					 On display there were works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu, books and photos introducing Songun Korea and art pieces associated with the wisdom and talent of the Korean people.
					
					 Vice mayor of Podolsk City of Moscow Region said:
					
					 The WPK has advanced along the road of steady victories and developed into a party which enjoys the highest prestige in the world and achieved single-hearted unity under the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It is steadily developing and the DPRK is displaying its might as a political, ideological and military power thanks to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The mayor of the Dimitrovgrad City, Bulgaria said that he was pleased to see a good exhibition opened in the city on the occasion of the anniversary of the WPK. The exhibition will make a contribution to the development of the friendly relations between the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 The director of the Education and Socio-Development Department of a city office, Peru said the exhibition would offer a good occasion of helping its citizens know well about the politics, economy and culture, the high level of culture of the Korean people in particular. The director wished the WPK and the Korean people greater successes in their struggle.

articles.title: Foreign Media Mark WPK's Birthday
articles.content:
Foreign Media Mark WPK's Birthday
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Papers of India and Germany gave special write-ups to mark the 68th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Papers of India on Oct. 5 carried articles under the caption of "On the occasion of the 68th anniversary of the WPK" accompanied with a photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 New Delhi Times noted that it is by no means symbolic that the WPK is holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as its eternal general secretary, adding that his idea and line serve as the eternal guidelines for the party.
					
					 It continued:
					
					 The validity and the great vitality of his Songun political line are clearly proved in practice in the DPRK.
					
					 He always lives along with the ever-victorious WPK leading the general advance of the Korean people for building a thriving nation.
					
					 Passion India noted that the WPK is called the mother party by the people.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The great leader of the mother party is First Secretary Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The love for people is the starting point of all his thinking and activities and the supreme principle and supreme objective of the politics enforced by him.
					
					 The party led by him will always emerge victorious, enjoying the absolute support and trust of the people as the mother party.
					
					 The German paper Rote Fahne in its October issue carried an article titled "The anniversary of the WPK" saying that the glorious WPK was founded on Oct. 10, 1945, and it has kept to the road of socialism under the wise leadership of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Indonesian Figure Lauds WPK
articles.content:
Indonesian Figure Lauds WPK
 Pyongyang, October 15 (KCNA) -- Harinde Singh, secretary general of the National Leading Council of the Diversity Party of Indonesia, issued a statement on Oct. 8 on the occasion of the 68th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 He said the founding of the WPK on Oct. 10, 1945 was a historic occasion for bringing about a fundamental turn in carving out the destiny of the Korean people.
					
					 The WPK is the party of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, he noted, and went on:
					
					 The President is the eternal leader of the party and the people as he founded the party and led it only to victory and glory.
					
					 Under his wise leadership, the party backed the founding of the DPRK by leading the Korean people to victory, and built a self-supporting national economy and established the socialist system centered on the popular masses.
					
					 Kim Jong Il is the eternal general secretary of the party who strengthened the WPK into the party of the President and led the revolutionary cause of Songun to victory.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Korean people and first secretary of the WPK, is successfully carrying forward the idea and cause of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The WPK led by him will always lead to victory the Korean people in their efforts to build a thriving nation.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje al presidente de Mongolia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje al presidente de Mongolia
Pyongyang, 15 de octubre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 65o aniversario del establecimiento de relaciones diplomaticas Republica Popular Democratica de Corea -Mongolia, el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 15 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de Mongolia, Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj.
					  El remitente senala en su misiva que al establecerse las relaciones diplomaticas entre los dos paises hace 65 anos, el 15 de octubre de 1948, los pueblos de ambos paises pudieron desarrollar continuamente los lazos de verdadera amistad y cooperacion basados en el ideal comun sobre el desarrollo independiente.
					
					  Satisfecho de que las relaciones de amistad y colaboracion entre los dos paises con larga historia y tradicion se desarrollaran favorablemente en varios dominios en los ultimos anos, expuso la conviccion de que ellas se ampliaran y se fortaleceran con energia en el futuro gracias a los esfuerzos conjuntos.
					
					  Deseo de todo corazon al amistoso pueblo mongol mayor progreso y prosperidad y al destinatario nuevos exitos en su trabajo responsable.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju recorre distritos de Sukchon y Oncho
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju recorre distritos de Sukchon y Onchon
Pyongyang, 15 de octubre (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea Pak Pong Ju recorrio la Granja de Yoldusamchon del distrito Sukchon y la Granja Cooperativa de Ansok del distrito Onchon, de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur donde se registran innovaciones en la cosecha y la trilla.
					En el encuentro con los funcionarios y campesinos ejemplares de las granjas, Pak elogio los exitos logrados por ellos en sus trabajos, se entero del estado de la tasacion de la cosecha prevista y del aseguramiento de materiales de las unidades concernientes y sostuvo la reunion consultiva.
					
					En la reunion el se refirio a la necesidad de concentrar todos los esfuerzos a la agricultura en acato al legado de los Generalisimos y al proposito del Mariscal Kim Jong Un y cultivar la tierra de manera cientifica y tecnica.
					
					Subrayo que deben obtener nuevas variedades adecuadas al clima y las condiciones naturales de Corea al materializar estrictamente la linea del partido de hacer la revolucion de semilla.
					
					Tomo medidas para realizar la industrializacion y la modernizacion de la agricultura acelerando la revolucion cientifica y tecnica en el sector agricola y acabar con exito la agricultura de este ano logrando que  las unidades relacionadas suministren suficientemente la electricidad y combustibles necesarios a la cosecha y la trilla.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok se reune con el encargado de negocios a. i. de Siria
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok se reune con el encargado de negocios a. i. de Siria
Pyongyang, 15 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, departio el dia 15 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el encargado de negocios a. i. de la Republica Arabe de Siria acreditado en Corea, Tammam Sulaiman, que le hizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Ofrecido banquete por dia de establecimiento de relaciones diplomaticas Corea-Mongolia
articles.content:
Ofrecido banquete por dia de establecimiento de relaciones diplomaticas Corea-Mongolia
Pyongyang, 15 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 15 un banquete en ocasion del 65o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas con Mongolia.
					  A la recepcion fueron invitados el embajador Manibadrakh Ganbold y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica de este pais asiatico acreditada en Corea.
					
					  Estuvieron presentes el canciller Pak Ui Chun, el vicecanciller Pak Kil Yon y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					  En su discurso Pak dijo que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Mongolia acogen nueva era de prosperidad de su desarrollo bajo la extraordinaria atencion de los maximos dirigentes de ambos paises.
					
					  Prosiguio que ampliar las relaciones de amistad con Mongolia con larga tradicion historica conforme a la demanda de nueva epoca, es la posicion invariable del gobierno de la RPDC.
					
					  Deseo que el gobierno y pueblo de Mongolia logren mayores exitos en las labores para lograr la estabilidad y unidad sociopoliticas y desarrollar la economia y la cultura nacionales.
					
					  El embajador mongol, en su discurso, dijo que el pueblo mongol celebra con significacion junto con el pueblo coreano el 65o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre dos paises.
					
					  Subrayo que dos paises deben ampliar y desarrollar mas en varios sectores las relaciones de cooperacion.
					
					  Expreso la conviccion de que se abrira en este ano significado el nuevo capitulo en las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises.

articles.title: Canciller coreano se reune con delegacion de OMS
articles.content:
Canciller coreano se reune con delegacion de OMS
Pyongyang, 15 de octubre (ACNC) -- El canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Ui Chun, departio este martes con la delegacion de la Organizacion Mundial de la Salud encabezada por Samlee Plianbangchang, director de la Oficina Regional de Sudeste Asiatico, que le hizo una visita de cortesia.
					Estuvieron presentes los funcionarios de la cancilleria coreana y el delegado de la OMS en Corea.

articles.title: Ofrecido banquete en honor de delegacion gubernamental de Congo
articles.content:
Ofrecido banquete en honor de delegacion gubernamental de Congo
Pyongyang, 15 de octubre (ACNC) -- El gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 15 un banquete en honor de la delegacion del gobierno de la Republica de Congo de visita en Corea.
					Al convite fueron invitados los miembros de la delegacion del pais africano encabezada por el ministro de Cultura y Arte, Gakosso Jean Claude.
					
					Estuvieron presentes el ministro de Cultura Pak Chun Nam y otros funcionarios coreanos.
